personal.name: Ebin Amson
personal.tagline: Building scalable web solutions with AI-powered innovation
personal.bio: Undergraduate Computer Science Engineer at S.O.E, CUSAT. Full-stack developer focused on modern web technologies like Next.js, scalable backend systems, and AI-powered applications. Actively working with Agentic AI systems, performance optimization, and accessibility-first design. Experienced across the MERN ecosystem and evolving toward production-grade, scalable web solutions.

education.institution: Cochin University of Science and Technology (CUSAT)

experience.description: Built a web + WhatsApp EdTech platform for course creation and student enrollment. Implemented WhatsApp automation workflows and developed backend services with Next.js, TypeScript, Prisma, and NeonDB.
Developed a MERN stack pre-ordering platform for hybrid engine-based products. Designed and implemented authentication, UI, and database integration with secure transactions and real-time updates.

projects.title: ReadMe-AI
projects.description: AI-powered platform to auto-generate README files from GitHub repositories. Integrated Google Generative AI with GraphQL backend for job management and API tracking.

projects.title: Podcast Platform
projects.description: Full-stack podcast platform enabling users to listen, upload, and share podcasts. Built with React, Node.js, MongoDB, and Cloudinary with cookie-based authentication.

projects.title: Social Media Platform
projects.description: A modern full-stack social media platform enabling users to create, share, and interact with posts and images. Features authentication, media uploads, likes, comments, and a clean responsive UI.

achievements.title: First Prize – CodeQuest’25 Hackathon
achievements.description: Secured first place at CodeQuest’25, conducted as part of INNERVE’25 by CODIAC (Association of CSE), College of Engineering Muttathara on 8th March 2025.

achievements.title: First Prize – HackTillDawn Hackathon
achievements.description: Won first prize at the HackTillDawn hackathon conducted by Mar Athanasius College of Engineering (MACE), Kothamangalam.

achievements.title: Second Prize – TakeDown Hackathon
achievements.description: Secured second prize at the TakeDown Hackathon held on 24–25 February 2025 at UCE College of Engineering, Thrissur, organized by RACE & FOSS Club.

achievements.title: First Prize – Hack for Tomorrow
achievements.description: Grateful to win first prize and a cash award of ₹15,000 at the Hack for Tomorrow Hackathon organized by Model Engineering College.

achievements.title: Third Prize – Code Kalari Hackathon
achievements.description: Secured third place at the Code Kalari Hackathon organized by IIIT Kottayam, competing with students from various colleges across India, and received a cash prize of ₹30,000.
